page.syntax: User_Count as N = A5_REGISTRATION_LICENSE_INUSE(fileName as c[,N serial_start,N count])

argument.name: fileName
argument.description: Character. The name of the file tracking concurrent users.

page.description: Return the number of users logged in via a .muf file, optional license key if checking a *different* installation (for example runtime).
page.discussion: The A5_REGISTRATION_LICENSE_INUSE() function counts the number of users in .MUF and .RMUF files. This makes it easier for developers to control the number of simultaneous users of an application. When an application is opened (i.e. an .ADB file is opened), Alpha Anywhere keeps track of the number of simultaneous users of that application in a .MUF file with the same name as the .ADB file. If the application is opened using Runtime, Alpha Anywhere keeps track of the number of users in a .RMUF file. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.description: Open a second copy of AlphaSports.
Open a third copy of AlphaSports using the Alpha Anywhere Runtime and check the .RMUF file.
Close the second copy of AlphaSports.
This example gets the total number of users of the current application.
section.example: dim MUFFile as C MUFFile = file.filename_parse(a5.get_name() ,"dpn") + ".muf" dim RMUFFile as C RMUFFile = file.filename_parse(a5.get_name() ,"dpn") + ".rmuf" dim totalUsers as N totalUsers = a5_registration_license_inuse(MUFFile) + a5_registration_license_inuse(RMUFFile)
